OTHER PRESENT: SRI.B.JAYASURYA SR PP THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 09.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: au Crl.MC.No.132 OF 2020(F) 2 2020/KER/928 ORDER Dated this the 9th day of January 2020 The petitioner is the registered owner of a Tipper lorry bearing registration No. KL-19-A 6669. The vehicle was seized allegedly for the involvement of offences under the provisions of Kerala Minor Mineral Concession Rule, 2015. No FIR has been registered. The Sub Inspector of Police, Parippally has filed a report to the Revenue Divisional Officer, Kollam and thereafter the petitioner filed a petition before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court (Temporary), South Paravur, Kollam under Section 457 of Cr.PB.C. for interim custody of the Tipper lorry belonging to him. Vide order at Annexure I, the lorry was directed to be released to the petitioner. The petitioner is aggrieved by condition No.7 which states that the original documents of the vehicle shall be kept in safe custody of the Court and the petitioner shall be issued with a true copy certified from the Court for all legal and practical purposes. The petitioner states that in view of this order, he could not ply the vehicle because it is essential that the original documents be kept with the vehicle. au Crl.MC.No.132 OF 2020(F) 3 2020/KER/928 In view of the fact that no crime has been registered against the petitioner, imposing of such condition cannot be justified. The condition No.7 is therefore modified to the extent that the petitioner shall produce the _ original documents and certified copy of the same shall be retained in the court, while the original shall be returned to the petitioner. The Crl.M.C is allowed.
